references.paper_title: SimGNN: A neural network approach to fast graph similarity computation
references.reason: This paper is foundational for neural graph retrieval methods and introduced a novel approach to fast graph similarity computation using neural networks.
This paper introduced the Neuromatch model, a key early approach to subgraph matching using graph neural networks that directly inspired the IsoNet model which this paper improves upon.

references.paper_title: Interpretable neural subgraph matching for graph retrieval
references.reason: This paper introduced the IsoNet model, which is directly improved upon by the IsoNet++ model introduced in this paper.

references.paper_title: Graph matching networks for learning the similarity of graph structured objects
references.reason: This paper introduced the Graph Matching Network (GMN), a powerful early interaction network for graph matching that this paper builds upon and improves.

references.paper_title: Sinkhorn distances: Lightspeed computation of optimal transport
references.reason: This paper introduced the Sinkhorn algorithm which is used in this paper to efficiently compute optimal transport, a key element in the proposed subgraph isomorphism approach.
